spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Shocking Grasp (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit (with advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal), reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Eldritch Blast (Cantrip
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage.

trait.name: Prone to Possession
entries: When the warlock is reduced below half it's hitpoints (16 or less), it must make a {@dc 15} charisma saving throw. If they fail, they are possessed by Mammok and transform into a {@creature Nergaliid|EGW} that is under Mammok's control. This transformation is permanent. It must repeat this saving throw at the beginning of each of it's turns that it starts with 16 hitpoints or less.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Vebshi's spellcasting ability is Charisma. it can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Vebshi is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Cunning
entries: Vebshi can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: The Odds are in My Favor
entries: Vebshi has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to shove a creature if at least one of the xvart's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

item.name: Metamagic prism
entries: This curious contraption includes three crystals, set inside gold rings, which are connected to a central ring. The prism can be attached to any spellcasting focus. It has three charges. When a spell is cast by a caster that is wielding a spellcasting focus with the prism attached, they can expend a charge to engage one of the crystals as part of the casting of the spell:

items: Gem of shifting elements. A round crystal that changes colors in response to the attuned caster’s thoughts or emotions. When engaged during the casting a spell that deals a type of damage from the following list, that damage type can be changed to one of the other listed types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, thunder.

Temporal distortion shard. A crystal shard with a rough surface, with small silvery flakes that glisten from the inside. Looking through it, the image becomes distorted - not only spatially, but also temporally, as the world seems to slightly speed up or slow down at times. When engaged during the casting of a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

Dampening stone. A greyish, opaque crystal that almost seems to suck the color out of its immediate surroundings. When engaged during the casting of a spell, the verbal and somatic components of that spell can be ignored.

entries: The prism regains 1d4 charges at dawn. It cannot have more than 3 charges at any given time.

item.name: Wrappings of Ki Reversal
entries: These wrappings can be incorporated into garments or weapons. They allow a monk who attunes to them to target their foe’s ki and disrupt or manipulate it. The wrappings have 3 charges. As a bonus action, the wielder may expend a charge and prepare to use the wrappings as part of their next attack (every monk may use them to attack or as part of an attack in a different way - be creative!). The next time the wielder hits a creature with a monk weapon or unarmed strike, they may choose one of the following options; Saving throws are made against the wearer’s Ki save DC:

items: Block the flow. Roll the attack’s damage die one additional time. The target is dealt necrotic damage equal to the number rolled. The target must also make a Strength saving throw or be restrained. At the end of each of the target’s turns, they may repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. The target may also stabilize their stance as an action and end the effect automatically.

Change the course. Roll the attack’s damage die one additional time. The target is dealt force damage equal to the number rolled. The target must also make a Constitution saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from the wielder and knocked prone.

Darken the mind. Roll the attack’s damage die one additional time. The target is dealt psychic damage equal to the number rolled. The target must also make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the wielder. At the end of each of the target’s turns, they may repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. The target may also regain their composure as an action and end the effect automatically.

entries: It is not possible to prepare more than one effect at a time.
The wrappings regain 1d4 charges at dawn. The wielder may also expend one Ki point as a free action to add one charge to them. The wrappings cannot have more than 3 charges at any given time.
